channel.title: Australasian Applied Statistics Conference
channel.description: Recent content on Australasian Applied Statistics Conference

item.title: Invited Speaker: Dr Arthur Gilmour
item.description: ASReML in Practice Biography: Arthur Gilmour obtained his B Sc Agr from Sydney University majoring in Biometry in 1970 with a NSW Government traineeship. He then served as a biometrician until his retirement from NSW Agriculture as a Principal Research Scientist in 2009. From the outset, he was involved in software development to meet the current statistical analysis needs of his clients and colleagues. He obtained his PhD in animal breeding from Massey University in 1983 during which time he came into contact with Robin Thompson.

item.title: Invited Speaker: Dr Petra Kuhnert
item.description: Deep Learning for prediction and forecasting of Agricultural processes

item.title: Invited Speaker: Prof Di Cook
item.description: Data visualisation: Bridging the long-standing gap between exploratory and inferential statistics

item.title: Workshop: Visualization and Data Mining
item.description: Visualization and Data Mining Morning session: Sustenance for the every day statistical analysis This part covers making plots using the grammar of graphics and how this fits into statistical inference. We will use the tidyverse suite of packages and nullabor. Afternoon session: Looking at the model in the data space This part will cover the use of tours to examine multivariate spaces, in relation to various data mining methods, including dimension reduction, supervised and unsupervised classification models.

item.title: Workshop: Genstat 20ed Masterclass: data mining and advanced modelling
item.description: Genstat 20ed Masterclass: data mining and advanced modelling In this masterclass we will explore some of the data mining and more advanced statistical modelling facilities available in Genstat. As not all these facilities are available in the menus, the session will begin with a brief recap of Genstat’s command language. Topics will include: Genstat command language data mining association rules self-organising maps discriminant analysis support vector machines classification trees and random forests $k$-nearest-neighbours classification advanced modelling specialised regression (e.

item.title: Invited Speaker: A/Prof Emyln Williams
item.description: The application of CycDesigN in designing experiments for use in agriculture

item.title: Workshop: Tidy Model Selection for PractioneRs
item.description: Tidy Model Selection for PractioneRs Model selection is fundamental in many scientific fields for gaining insight into how response/s are informed by a set of measured predictors. This workshop focuses on two key aspects of the model selection routine for practitioners: (1) introducing and implementing a variety of model selection approaches including stepwise procedures, information criterion, and regularisation and screening methods for (generalised) linear models, and (2) constructing a reproducible and streamlined tidy workflow from data wrangling → model fitting and selection → reporting of results and evaluation of selection procedure/s as a whole.

item.title: Invited Speaker: Dr Francis Hui
item.description: All Under One Roof – The Rise of Joint Species Distribution Modeling in Ecology

item.title: AASC2020 coming to Victoria
item.description: At AASC2018, Rotorua, New Zealand, it was decided that the next Australasian Applied Statistics Conference will be held in Victoria. Murray Hannah will chair this next AASC.

item.title: Register your interest
item.description: To be notified of future updates about AASC2020, please fill out the form here.

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: The Australasian Applied Statistics Conference (AASC) is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate unprofessional or inappropriate conduct, which includes discrimination and harassment, sexual or otherwise. Conference participants should always work towards maintaining an environment free of harassment and discrimination. At the discretion of the AASC conference organisers, any participants violating these rules may be asked to leave the conference, without any fee refund.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Do I have to register for the conference to sign up for the workshop? No. You can register for the workshop alone. Is there a code of conduct for this conference? Yes there is. Registrants are required to abide by code of conduct found here.
